verses.devanagari: श्रोतव्यं सततं तस्मात्सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् । ब्रह्माण्डपुराणं पुण्यं सर्वानन्दप्रदायकम् ॥ १० ॥
verses.iast:
oṁ namo bhagavate vāsudevāya
janmādy asya yataḥ sṛṣṭi-sthiti-layāḥ
satyasya jñānānandasya brahmaṇaḥ
paramātmanaḥ
verses.translation: Om! I bow to the blessed Lord Vāsudeva, the Supreme Self, from whom arise creation, preservation, and dissolution, who is truth, knowledge, and bliss.

verses.devanagari: श्रोतव्यं सततं तस्मात्सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् । ब्रह्माण्डपुराणं पुण्यं सर्वानन्दप्रदायकम् ॥ १० ॥
verses.iast:
viṣṇoḥ paramaṁ rūpaṁ sattva-rūpaṁ sanātanam
śuddhaṁ sac-cid-ānandaṁ yad brahma paramaṁ viduḥ
verses.translation: The supreme form of Viṣṇu is eternal, pure existence-consciousness-bliss, composed of sattva, which the wise know as the highest Brahman.

verses.devanagari: श्रोतव्यं सततं तस्मात्सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् । ब्रह्माण्डपुराणं पुण्यं सर्वानन्दप्रदायकम् ॥ १० ॥
verses.iast:
namo ’stu nīlakaṇṭhāya sahasrākṣāya śambhave
kāraṇāya namas tubhyaṁ kāraṇānāṁ ca kāraṇe
verses.translation: Obeisance to the blue-throated Lord Śambhu, the thousand-eyed, the cause of all causes.

verses.devanagari: श्रोतव्यं सततं तस्मात्सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् । ब्रह्माण्डपुराणं पुण्यं सर्वानन्दप्रदायकम् ॥ १० ॥
verses.iast:
yasya prasādāt sarvasya prasādaḥ syāt prabhoḥ sadā
yasya krodhād bhayaṁ sarvaṁ tasmai śambhave namaḥ
verses.translation: By whose grace everyone prospers, by whose anger all are struck with fear—to that Lord Śambhu I bow.
